org.eclipse.january.dataset

Class RGBDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyDatasetBase
      • org.eclipse.january.dataset.AbstractDataset
        • org.eclipse.january.dataset.AbstractCompoundDataset
          • org.eclipse.january.dataset.CompoundShortDataset
            • org.eclipse.january.dataset.RGBDataset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, CompoundDataset, Dataset, IDataset, ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable

    public class RGBDataset
extends CompoundShortDataset
implements Cloneable
    Class to hold colour datasets as red, green, blue tuples of short integers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createFromObject

        public static RGBDataset createFromObject(Object obj)
        Create a RGB dataset from an object which could be a Java list, array (of arrays...) or Number. Ragged sequences or arrays are padded with zeros. The item size is the last dimension of the corresponding elemental dataset
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
        dataset with contents given by input

      • createFromCompoundDataset

        public static RGBDataset createFromCompoundDataset(CompoundDataset a)
        Create a RGB dataset from a compound dataset (no normalisation performed)
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:
        RGB dataset (grey if input dataset has less than 3 elements per item)

      • createFromHSV

        public static RGBDataset createFromHSV(Dataset hue,
                                       Dataset saturation,
                                       Dataset value)
        Create a RGB dataset from hue, saturation and value dataset
        Parameters:
        hue - (in degrees from -360 to 360)
        saturation - (from 0 to 1), can be null to denote 1
        value - (from 0 to 1)
        Returns:
        RGB dataset

      • createFromHSL

                                       Dataset saturation,
                                       Dataset lightness)

        Parameters:
        hue - (in degrees from -360 to 360)
        saturation - (from 0 to 1), can be null to denote 1
        lightness - (from 0 to 1)
        Returns:
        RGB dataset

      • max

        public Number max(boolean... ignored)
        Specified by:
        max in interface IDataset
        Overrides:
        max in class AbstractCompoundDataset
        Parameters:
        ignored - - Can be null, empty, or one or more booleans. By default, all booleans are false. If the first boolean is true, will ignore NaNs and ignore infinities. Use the second boolean to ignore infinities separately.
        Returns:
        Maximum value
